definition: unreasonable/shocking/outrageous/also written 不像話|不像话
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.chinese: 这次考试容易得不象话。

sentences.english: Floor master is not like words, how can you post such thread .
sentences.chinese: 楼主不象话，怎么能发这种帖？

sentences.english: It's a shame John eats sweets whenever he gets the chance.
sentences.chinese: 约翰只要有机会就吃糖，真不象话。

sentences.english: It would be ungracious of me to give you less than he gave me.
sentences.chinese: 如果我给你的比他给我的少，那就太不象话了。

sentences.english: It is immoral that a mattress should have so much power.
sentences.chinese: 这很不象话，一个床垫有这么大的威力。

sentences.english: It was indecent of them to talk business at the funeral.
sentences.chinese: 他们在葬礼上谈生意经，真不象话。

sentences.english: You have some nerve thinking I went out with another guy.
sentences.chinese: 太不象话了，你竟然认为我同另外一个男孩子出去了。

sentences.english: That little boy has some nerve quarrelling with his teacher.
sentences.chinese: 那个小男孩太不象话，竟然和他的老师吵架。

definition: not according with decorum (idiom); scandalous/bad form/unacceptable behavior
in no shape to be seen/unpresentable/beyond recognition
see 不像話|不像话[bu4 xiang4 hua4]
how can this be so? (idiom); preposterous/ridiculous/absurd
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
